title: Pelluhue
text:
Pelluhue (in <a href="Mapudungun">Mapudungun</a>: "land of clams") is a <a href="List%20of%20towns%20in%20Chile">town</a> and <a href="Communes%20of%20Chile">commune</a> in the <a href="Cauquenes%20Province">Cauquenes Province</a> of central <a href="Chile">Chile</a>'s seventh <a href="Regions%20of%20Chile">region</a> of <a href="Maule%20Region">Maule</a>.
Geography.
The commune of Pelluhue has an area of and is bordered on the north by <a href="Chanco%20%28Chile%29">Chanco</a>, on the south by <a href="Cobquecura">Cobquecura</a> (<a href="%C3%91uble%20Region">Ñuble Region</a>), on the east by <a href="Cauquenes">Cauquenes</a> and on the west by the <a href="Pacific%20Ocean">Pacific Ocean</a>. Its <a href="Capital%20%28political%29">seat</a> is the town of <a href="Curanipe">Curanipe</a>.
Demography.
Although <a href="Curanipe">Curanipe</a> is the municipal seat, Pelluhue has a greater population, both permanent and seasonal. According to the 2002 <a href="census">census</a> of the <a href="National%20Statistics%20Institute%20%28Chile%29">National Statistics Institute</a>, Pelluhue spans an area of and has 6,414 inhabitants (3,408 men and 3,006 women). Of these, 3,877 (60.4%) lived in <a href="urban%20area">urban area</a>s and 2,537 (39.6%) in <a href="rural%20area">rural area</a>s. Because of its appeal as a <a href="tourism">tourism</a> and <a href="retirement">retirement</a> center, Pelluhue has been steadily growing over the last two decades. Its population increase rate has been one of the highest in the <a href="Maule%20Region">Maule Region</a>, growing by 17.2% (943 persons) between the 1992 and 2002 censuses.
History.
Both towns, Pelluhue and Curanipe, are nowadays popular coastal <a href="resort">resort</a>s. Pelluhue evolved from a humble <a href="fishermen">fishermen</a>'s <a href="cove">cove</a> to a crowded <a href="seaside%20resort">summer resort</a> in less than 50 years. The town's population swells to over several thousand in the summer week-ends when <a href="tourist">vacationer</a>s from the "<a href="hinterland">hinterland</a>" (<a href="Cauquenes">Cauquenes</a>, <a href="Linares%2C%20Chile">Linares</a>, <a href="Talca">Talca</a>, <a href="Parral%2C%20Chile">Parral</a>) visit the <a href="coast">seaside</a>.
Curanipe has a more "<a href="Patrician%20%28post-Roman%20Europe%29">patrician</a>" past, having been already a well-known and secluded coastal resort for the Cauquenes elite and a proud "minor port", in the mid- and late 19th century and early 20th century. Both Pelluhue and Curanipe were part of the municipality of <a href="Chanco%2C%20Chile">Chanco</a> until 1979. The <a href="municipality">municipality</a> and commune (<a href="Spanish%20language">Spanish</a>:"<a href="comuna">comuna</a>") of Pelluhue was officially created on October 26, 1979, when both towns, together with their adjacent <a href="territory%20%28country%20subdivision%29">territories</a>, formed a new municipality.
The Curanipe <a href="parish%20church">parish church</a> of Santo Toribio is a preserved religious building overlooking the town.
From the <a href="ecclesiastical">ecclesiastical</a> point of view, Pelluhue belongs to the <a href="Parish">Parish</a> of Curanipe, of the <a href="Diocese%20of%20Linares%2C%20Chile">Diocese of Linares</a>, Chile.
Administration.
As a commune, Pelluhue is a third-level <a href="administrative%20division%20of%20Chile">administrative division of Chile</a> administered by a <a href="municipal%20council">municipal council</a>, headed by an <a href="alcalde">alcalde</a> who is directly elected every four years. The 2008-2012 alcalde is Carlos Zúñiga Villaseñor (<a href="Independent%20Democratic%20Union">UDI</a>).
Within the <a href="electoral%20divisions%20of%20Chile">electoral divisions of Chile</a>, Pelluhue is represented in the <a href="Chamber%20of%20Deputies%20of%20Chile">Chamber of Deputies</a> by Guillermo Ceroni (<a href="Party%20for%20Democracy%20%28Chile%29">PPD</a>) and Ignacio Urrutia (UDI) as part of the 40th electoral district, together with <a href="Longav%C3%AD">Longaví</a>, <a href="Retiro%2C%20Chile">Retiro</a>, <a href="Parral%2C%20Chile">Parral</a>, <a href="Cauquenes">Cauquenes</a> and <a href="Chanco%2C%20Chile">Chanco</a>. The commune is represented in the <a href="Senate%20of%20Chile">Senate</a> by <a href="Hern%C3%A1n%20Larra%C3%ADn">Hernán Larraín</a> (UDI) and Ximena Rincón González (<a href="Christian%20Democratic%20Party">PDC</a>) as part of the 11th senatorial constituency (Maule-South).
Attractions and tourism.
In the southernmost corner of the municipality, which borders the <a href="B%C3%ADo-B%C3%ADo%20Region">Bío Bío Region</a>, lies the semi-isolated beach of Tregualemu, next to which there are two old, large rural houses of <a href="Chile">Chile</a>an <a href="colonial%20style">colonial style</a>.
The "<a href="Los%20Ruiles">Los Ruiles</a>" National <a href="Park">Reserve</a> is a <a href="park">park</a> in the easternmost part of the municipality, located in the <a href="foothills">foothills</a> of the "<a href="Chilean%20Coast%20Range">Cordillera de la Costa</a>". A small oasis next to the road that connects <a href="Chanco%20%28Chile%29">Chanco</a> and <a href="Cauquenes">Cauquenes</a>, the park contains many <a href="Endemic%20%28ecology%29">native species</a> of trees and plants. Several of them are unique to the region and some are in danger of <a href="extinction">extinction</a>. The <a href="Nature%20reserve">reserve</a> has a surface of 29 hectares. There is a reception area, several picnic tables and two footpaths.
Earthquake.
On February 27, 2010, Pelluhue and Curanipe were partially destroyed by <a href="2010%20Chile%20earthquake">an earthquake</a> measuring 8.8 on the <a href="moment%20magnitude%20scale">moment magnitude scale</a>, and its associated <a href="tsunami">tsunami</a> that left 60 ft fishing vessels in the streets, the towns "covered in mud" and hundreds of homes "completely gone", as reported by the press. Scores of bodies have been found in the area and an estimated 300 homes were destroyed in Pelluhue alone. The commune of Pelluhue lies close to the town of <a href="Cobquecura">Cobquecura</a>, the reported <a href="epicenter">epicenter</a> of the earthquake.
